question: You are a code expert, please use your professional knowledge to generate accurate and professional responses. Try to ensure the code you generate is executable for demonstration. Using JS, write a complete webpage that uses face-api.js to automatically enhance people in camera video, including face slimming, skin whitening, eye enlargement, makeup changing, outfit changing and other features. Display a final output video window that is complete, aesthetically pleasing, perfect, smooth, and seamless. Use the latest technology with complete usable source code. Pay attention to details, make the interface beautiful with a sci-fi style, at a product-grade level.

checklist.title: Is face detection and tracking correctly implemented using face-api.js?
checklist.description: Verify if the code correctly integrates face-api.js for robust face detection and tracking. Check if it loads the required models (SSD MobileNet, facial landmarks, etc.), handles multiple faces, and maintains tracking between frames. Score 0 if basic face detection is missing, 5 if only basic detection works, and 10 if detection includes accurate landmark tracking with proper error handling for lighting variations and partial face visibility.

checklist.title: Are all required beauty enhancement features fully implemented?
checklist.description: Evaluate whether the code implements all requested beauty features (face slimming, skin whitening, eye enlargement, makeup changing, outfit changing). Check if each effect uses appropriate algorithms: face slimming should use mesh warping with landmark controls; skin whitening needs color correction with tone preservation; eye enlargement should use proportional landmark manipulation; makeup should utilize layer blending with alpha masks; outfit changing requires body segmentation and virtual try-on. Deduct 2 points for each missing feature or 1 point if poorly implemented. Full score requires all features with smooth transitions between them.

checklist.title: Is the real-time video processing optimized for performance?
checklist.description: Assess whether the code employs optimization techniques for smooth real-time processing (target of 30+ FPS). Check for: worker thread utilization for computation-heavy tasks, WebGL/GPU acceleration for filters, downsampling during heavy processing, keyframe interval optimization, and proper memory management to prevent leaks. Score 10 if processing runs at 30+ FPS on mid-range hardware with negligible latency, 5 if noticeable but usable lag exists, and 0 if processing causes severe frame drops or browser crashes.

checklist.title: Does the application provide user controls for adjusting enhancement parameters?
checklist.description: Check if the interface provides intuitive controls for users to adjust the intensity and parameters of each enhancement feature. Each effect should have at least a basic intensity slider, and advanced options where appropriate. Score 10 if controls include: real-time preview, presets, individual feature toggles, intensity sliders with numerical values, and ability to save custom settings. Deduct 2 points for each major control type missing, and 5 points if parameters can't be adjusted at all.

checklist.title: Is the code robust?
checklist.description: Evaluate whether the code can handle common abnormal situations (such as camera access denial, unsupported browser, face not detected, poor lighting conditions, etc.) and provide friendly error prompts or recovery mechanisms. Code with strong robustness should be able to effectively handle these edge cases, giving 10 points. If the robustness is average, give 5 points, and if no exceptions are handled, give 0 points.

checklist.title: Are there any innovative features that are eye-catching?
checklist.description: Check whether the code includes surprise features that enhance the experience (e.g., 1. AR accessories overlay 2. Expression-triggered effects 3. Background replacement/blurring 4. Beauty filter history/comparison). Add 3 points for each practical innovative feature implemented (maximum 10 points).

checklist.title: Are there any redundant features?
checklist.description: Strictly check three types of redundancy: 1. Redundant implementation of similar filters (e.g., multiple skin smoothing algorithms running simultaneously) 2. Function modules unrelated to beauty enhancement (e.g., unrelated animations) 3. Fancy effects that affect performance (e.g., excessive particle effects that slow down processing). Deduct 3 points for each redundancy found, and directly deduct 10 points if the core functions are interfered with by redundant code.

checklist.title: Does the code have engineering quality?
checklist.description: Review modular design (such as separating camera handling/face detection/effect rendering/UI layers), error handling coverage, and resource management. Deduct 5 points if global state pollution is found or design patterns are not used; deduct 5 points if the code duplication rate is too high (over 30%); deduct 5 points if resources are not properly managed (memory leaks, no cleanup on page unload). The full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Does the interface vision meet sci-fi style and professional design standards?
checklist.description: Evaluate whether the overall design follows modern sci-fi design principles: 1) Futuristic color scheme (neon blues, purples with high contrast) 2) Proper layout with holographic-style elements 3) Clean typography with technical feel (display fonts â‰¥ 16px, monospace for data). Deduct 3 points for each non-sci-fi visual element, 5 points for inconsistent visual language, and 5 points for cluttered/confusing interface. Check if the UI has sci-fi touches like particle effects, glowing elements, or digital distortion effects. The full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Is the dynamic interaction smooth and seamless?
checklist.description: Judge whether the dynamic effects conform to human perception characteristics: 1) Video processing appears seamless with no visible 'jumps' when applying effects 2) UI transitions use appropriate animation duration (300-500ms) 3) Clear visual feedback when adjusting parameters. Deduct 5 points for each operation without feedback, 3 points for jarring transitions between beauty filter states, and 5 points for effects that create unnatural-looking results (e.g., uncanny valley face distortions). The full score is 10 points.
